page.title: 08WICHENFORD SCHOOL
page.content: {Wichenford School}was over 100 years old when it finally{closed in 1977. The ypung population of the village had fallen sharply, and now any young children of the new families must go to Martley and Hallow Schools. {In its prime}Wichenford School had {three teachers,}and an extension was built in 1958 to enable meals to be prepared on site, not transported from Hallow as before. The school catered for{5 to 11 year {olds,}and had a nature area and bean fields attached. The{vicar}came each week to teach {Religious Education,}and a morning assembly followed daily register. The children performed a{Nativity play in the church each December. They also had an{annual outing,}and a visit from the{Mobile Library}once a term. The{green uniform}had a{yellow}badge.
